author: @zupyak.com
title: Solar Energy In Florida A Powerful Way To Reduce Your Utility Costs
text:
In the Sunshine State, abundant sunlight offers a prime opportunity to harness
solar energy. Given the escalating utility costs and growing environmental concerns tied to traditional energy sources, the adoption of solar power has become a crucial consideration for many. Now, let's delve into the myriad ways you can reap the benefits of going solar in Florida.
What is Solar Energy?
Solar energy, derived from the sun's radiation and harnessed through solar panels, is a renewable and eco-friendly power source. Converting sunlight into electricity, it brings lower utility expenses, reduced reliance on fossil fuels, and emits no greenhouse gases during operation. With minimal upkeep and a long lifespan, investing in solar panels not only saves on electricity bills but also contributes to a greener future. Explore solar energy to cut utility costs and make a positive environmental impact.
How Does Solar Energy Work?
- Photovoltaic cells, found in solar panels, absorb sunlight.
- The absorbed sunlight excites electrons, creating an electric current.
- An inverter then converts the direct current (DC) into alternating current (AC), which can be used to power homes and businesses.
- A net metering system measures the electricity produced and sends excess power back into the grid.
- During periods of low sunlight, such as at night, stored energy from batteries can be utilized.
What Are the Benefits of Solar Energy?
Solar energy has gained popularity in recent years as a cost-effective and environmentally-friendly alternative to traditional energy sources. In this section, we will delve into the numerous benefits of utilizing solar energy in Florida. From reducing utility costs to decreasing your carbon footprint, solar energy has a multitude of advantages for both homeowners and the environment. Let's explore the benefits of this powerful energy source and how it can positively impact your daily life.
1. Reduces Utility Costs
- Research and compare solar companies to find a reputable provider.
- Understand and calculate your potential savings by analyzing your current energy usage and projected solar energy production.
- Schedule a consultation and site assessment to determine the feasibility of
solar installationon your property.
- Take advantage of available incentives and rebates to reduce the upfront cost of the system.
2. Renewable and Sustainable Energy Source
- Research and compare solar companies to find one that suits your specific needs.
- Understand and calculate your potential savings to determine the financial feasibility of switching to solar energy.
- Schedule a consultation and site assessment to determine if your roof is suitable for solar panel installation.
- Take advantage of available incentives and rebates to help reduce the upfront cost of installing a solar energy system.
- Install your solar energy system and start enjoying the benefits of reduced utility costs and a smaller carbon footprint.
3. Reduces Carbon Footprint
- Evaluate your energy needs and determine how much solar power you require.
- Consider your budget and research available financing options or incentives.
- Assess your roof's suitability for solar panel installation, taking into account its orientation and shading. This step is crucial as it directly contributes to reducing carbon footprint.
- Explore available incentives and rebates that can help offset the cost of your solar energy system.
4. Increases Property Value
- Research and compare solar companies to find a reputable and experienced installer.
- Understand and calculate the potential savings and return on investment that a solar energy system can provide.
- Schedule a consultation and site assessment with the chosen solar company to determine the feasibility and design of the system.
- Install the solar energy system on your property, ensuring that it is properly sized and installed according to local regulations.
What Factors Should You Consider Before Installing a Solar Energy System?
As the demand for
renewable energy sources grows, many Floridians are looking into installing solar energy systems to power their homes. However, before making the investment, it's important to carefully consider several factors. In this section, we'll discuss the key elements you should take into account before installing a solar energy system in your home, including your energy needs, budget, roof's suitability, and available incentives and rebates. By understanding these factors, you can make an informed decision about whether solar energy is the right choice for you and your household.
1. Your Energy Needs
- Analyze your energy consumption by reviewing past utility bills.
- Identify the appliances and devices that consume the most energy.
- Consider your future energy needs, such as adding new appliances or electric vehicles.
- Calculate the size of the solar energy system required to meet your energy needs.
- Consult with a solar energy professional to determine the best system size and configuration.
2. Your Budget
- Evaluate your current energy expenses and determine how much you can allocate towards a solar system.
- Research and compare the upfront costs, financing options, and potential return on investment of different solar companies.
- Consider the long-term savings and benefits that a solar energy system can provide, such as reduced utility costs and increased property value.
- Explore available incentives and rebates offered by the government or local utility companies to help offset the initial costs.
3. Your Roof's Suitability
- Evaluation: Determine if your roof receives sufficient sunlight throughout the day and is free from shading obstacles.
- Orientation: Ensure that your roof's orientation is ideal for capturing maximum sunlight, typically facing south.
- Structural Integrity: Confirm that your roof is structurally sound and can support the weight of solar panels.
- Roof Age: Consider the age of your roof, as it may need repairs or replacement before installing solar panels.
- Roof Material: Different roofing materials, such as asphalt shingles or metal, may require specific installation techniques.
4. Available Incentives and Rebates
There are various incentives and rebates available that can greatly reduce the cost of installing a solar energy system. In the United States, homeowners can claim up to 26% of the total system cost through federal tax credits. Many states also offer their own incentives and rebates, such as cash rebates or performance-based incentives. It is important to research and understand the specific incentives and rebates available in your location, as they may vary. By taking advantage of these programs, you can make solar energy more affordable and speed up the payback period of your system.
How Can You Get Started with Solar Energy in Florida?
If you‚Äôre ready to take advantage of solar energy in Florida and reduce your utility costs, there are a few steps you should take to get started. First, research and compare solar companies to find the best fit for your needs and budget. Then, understand and calculate your potential savings with solar energy. Next, schedule a consultation and site assessment to determine the best system for your home. Finally, install and enjoy the benefits of your new solar energy system. Let‚Äôs dive into these steps in more detail.
1. Research and Compare Solar Companies
- Start by researching local solar companies online, reading customer reviews, and checking their credentials.
- Compare the services and products offered by different companies, including their installation process, warranties, and customer support.
- Consider the company's experience and track record in the solar industry.
- Request quotes and compare the costs and financing options provided by each company.
- Review the company's portfolio and past projects to see if they have experience in installing solar systems similar to what you need.
- Contact the shortlisted companies to schedule consultations, during which you can ask questions and discuss your specific requirements.
- Ask for references and contact previous customers to get their feedback on the company's performance.
- Make a final decision based on the company's reputation, expertise, pricing, and customer reviews.
2. Understand and Calculate Your Savings
- Evaluate your current energy usage and determine your average electricity consumption.
- Research the cost of solar panels and installation to calculate the initial investment required.
- Consider available incentives and rebates, such as federal tax credits or state-specific programs, which can significantly reduce the overall cost.
- Calculate your potential savings by determining the electricity generation capabilities of your solar system based on your location and system size.
- Factor in the savings from reduced or eliminated monthly electricity bills, which can be substantial over the lifespan of the solar system.
- Compare your total savings over time to the initial investment to determine the payback period and return on investment.
3. Schedule a Consultation and Site Assessment
- Research reputable solar companies in your area.
- Contact the companies to schedule a consultation and site assessment.
- During the consultation, discuss your energy needs and goals.
- Provide the company with information about your property and roof.
- Arrange for a site assessment to determine the suitability of your property for solar panels.
- The company will evaluate factors such as sun exposure, shade, and structural integrity.
- Based on the assessment, the company will provide recommendations and a customized solar energy system design.
- Review the proposal and discuss financing options and available incentives.
- If satisfied, schedule the installation of your solar energy system.
- Once installed, enjoy the benefits of reduced utility costs and a greener energy source!
4. Install and Enjoy Your Solar Energy System
- Research and compare solar companies to find experienced and reputable installers.
- Understand and calculate your potential savings by analyzing your energy usage and the cost of installing a solar system.
- Schedule a consultation and site assessment with a solar company to evaluate your roof's suitability for
solar panels.
- Take advantage of available incentives and rebates to help offset the cost of installing your solar energy system.
- Proceed with the installation process, working closely with your chosen solar company to ensure proper placement of panels and system integration.
- Enjoy the benefits of your solar energy system, such as reduced utility costs and a reduced carbon footprint, while also increasing the value of your property.
Conclusion
Embracing solar energy in Florida offers a powerful solution to reduce utility costs and make a positive impact on the environment. With abundant sunlight, solar panels convert solar radiation into electricity, providing a renewable and sustainable energy source. By understanding the benefits of solar energy, including cost savings, reduced carbon footprint, and increased property value, homeowners can make informed decisions. Factors such as energy needs, budget, roof suitability, and available incentives should be carefully considered before installing a solar energy system. Researching and comparing solar companies, understanding potential savings, scheduling consultations, and assessing your property are crucial steps to getting started. Ultimately, investing in solar energy not only brings financial advantages but also contributes to a cleaner and greener future for Florida.

 SunScape Solar:

author: Ziv Chen
title: 2 Men Sentenced for Illegal Gambling Operations in Ohio
text:
Two Ohio men were handed jail sentences Monday for running
illegal gambling operations between 2009 and 2018. In addition to tax and gambling crimes, Christos Karasarides Jr. and Ronald DiPietro faced charges of money laundering, conspiracy, and obstruction of justice.
A federal jury
convicted both men in January 2024.
The pair owned multiple businesses, including Redemption and Skilled Shamrock. The latter saw visitors play
casino-style slot machines and spend over $34 million, generating $7 million in profits from 2012 to 2017. Karasarides and DiPietro tried to hide their ownership of these businesses through false contracts and nominee owners. Much of the criminal proceeds were used to buy luxury vehicles and properties.
In addition to running these illegal operations, Karasarides Jr. failed to report $2.3 million in income and pay $800,000 in taxes from 2012 to 2018. Karasarides was already in debt to the IRS from another gambling business. DiPietro, a Certified Public Accountant at the time, helped Karasarides make false representations to the IRS.
Karasarides obstructed the investigation in multiple ways, including creating false documents and tax reports. DiPietro and Karasarides cost the IRS $4.7 million and $5.4 million in tax losses, respectively.
Prison sentences
Karasarides was sentenced to 262 months in prison, followed by three years of supervised release. He must forfeit his residence and $419,768 in cash and pay $5,541,520 in restitution. During his arrest, authorities seized $150,000 in cash from the defendant's home and another $239,000 from a safe deposit box.
DiPietro was sentenced to 112 months in prison, followed by three years of supervised release along with $4,763,520 in restitution.

organizations.name: men sentenced for illegal gambling operations

author: Katherine Kallergis
title: Brand mogul Anand Khubani pays $40M for billionaire's North Bay Road mansion
text:
Brand mogul Anand Khubani added to his luxury portfolio in Miami Beach with the $40 million purchase of a waterfront mansion on North Bay Road.
Billionaire Jamie Salter, the founder, chairman and CEO of Authentic Brands Group, sold the recently completed estate at 5970
North Bay Road to Khubani, sources told The Real Deal.
In September, Khubani, founder and CEO of Wayne, New Jersey-based consumer brands company Ideavillage,
paid about $100 million for a 2.4-acre waterfront assemblage on La Gorce Island in Miami Beach, marking one of the biggest residential sales in South Florida last year. Khubani plans to build a waterfront home on the properties.
The North Bay Road estate he just acquired spans 14,520 square feet with six bedrooms, two staff rooms, a home office, movie theater, wine room and game room. The 0.7-acre property also includes a wellness center with a spa, sauna, steam room, cold plunge and hot bath, a waterfront pool and a pool on the second floor. The property was sold furnished.
An LLC led by Salter paid $19.3 million for the lot in 2021. Salter tapped architect Kobi Karp to design the mansion and Slim Keskes to handle the interiors.
Evan Weiss of 305 Degrees Realty represented Khubani in the off-market sale. Douglas Elliman agent Cyril Matz represented the seller.
Though sales velocity is down, the ultra-high-end market is still seeing record deals close, including other trades on North Bay Road.
Last year, David and Victoria Beckham paid
$72.3 million for a waterfront spec mansion, setting a record for single-family home sales on that street. Days later, Richard Saghian, the billionaire founder and CEO of Fashion Nova, paid $30 million for a waterfront spec home also on North Bay Road and the non-waterfront house across the street.
And in December, billionaire hedge fund manager Dan Loeb sold his waterfront mansion on North Bay Road
for about $35.5 million.
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->construction and property

author: HipHopDX
title: Travis Scott Gifts Fan His 'Favorite' Unreleased Nike Sneakers ‚Äî But With Strict Order
text: [Travis Scott](https://hiphopdx.com/artist/travis-scott) made a fan‚Äôs year less than a week into 2024 after gifting them a pair of unreleased Nike x Cactus Jack kicks right off his feet. The diehard rager was in the front row at La Flame‚Äôs Circus Maximus Tour show in Chicago on Wednesday (January 3) and went back-and-forth with the rapper himself while performing ‚ÄúLost Forever‚Äù without missing a beat. Scott was so impressed with the fan‚Äôs performance that he blessed him with the tan-colored Nike Shark-A-Don collaboration, which hasn‚Äôt yet hit shelves and is still without a release date for the general public. Travis had one request for the fan, though, and that was to not sell the shoes as he doesn‚Äôt want to see them end up on an auction site like eBay. AD LOADING... ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt sell my shoes, man,‚Äù he warned the fan. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre my favorite pair of shoes so don‚Äôt sell them. Ya dig what I‚Äôm saying? I love y‚Äôall, Chicago.‚Äù Find footage of the performance and a photo of the unreleased sneakers below. Travis Scott gave his shoes to a fan last night after he performed ‚ÄòLOST FOREVER‚Äô with them in Chicago üî• He even told the fan not to sell the unreleased signature pair as they‚Äôre his favorite üò≠ [pic.twitter.com/jZKRJYa1nE] ‚Äî CIRCUS MAXIMUS (@TRAVISONTOUR) [January 4, 2024] Travis Scott first revealed this unreleased Nike collaboration in October, with the kicks reportedly inspired by Nike‚Äôs Air Zoom Spiridon silhouette. If they do end up on an auction site, it wouldn‚Äôt be the first time that‚Äôs happened to Scott as [one fan sought a payday for his ‚ÄúUtopia‚Äù Air Jordan 1 Low sample](https://www.soleretriever.com/news/articles/travis-scott-worn-air-jordan-1-low-olive-utopia-rolling-loud-auction-details-2023) last month. AD LOADING... The ‚ÄúSicko Mode‚Äù hitmaker kicked off leg two [ of the Circus Maximus Tour](https://hiphopdx.com/news/travis-scott-fein-10-times-brooklyn) in Chicago and will hiy the road for U.S. dates in Boston, Milwaukee, Miami, Louisville and more. Travis will look to cap off his UTOPIA run and put a stamp on 2024 at the Grammy Awards next month, where [UTOPIA is nominated for Best Rap Album](https://hiphopdx.com/news/grammy-nominations-2024). The Houston native recalled his reaction to the nomination on The Tonight Show last month and [explained how much a victory would mean to him.](https://hiphopdx.com/news/travis-scott-utopia-grammy-nomination) ‚ÄúIt means a lot to me,‚Äù he told Jimmy Fallon. ‚ÄúI love music and I love the Academy. I think some of the most amazing artists and talented artists have achieved that. And as a producer and as a writer and as a musician, I take music very seriously. So I love it. It‚Äôs amazing.‚Äù AD LOADING... Travis has yet to win a Grammy but has been nominated 10 times in the past, including in the Album of the Year, Best Rap Song and Best Rap Performance categories.

author: Faustino Cuomo
title: DOBLE ALERTA por FUERTES TORMENTAS y vientos: CU√ÅNDO se larga y qu√© zona de Buenos Aires estar√° afectada
text: Este viernes, el[ Servicio Meteorol√≥gico Nacional (SMN) ](https://la100.cienradios.com/clima/alerta-meteorologica-amarilla-por-lluvias-y-vientos-fuertes-que-zonas-estan-en-peligro/)emiti√≥ una alerta naranja y amarilla por tormentas severas y vientos fuertes -que alcanzar√°n los 120 km/h- para varias provincias del pa√≠s. Dr√°stico cambio de clima a d√≠as de la llegada de ‚ÄúLa Ni√±a‚Äù: c√≥mo ser√°n las lluvias que traer√° el fen√≥meno meteorol√≥gico Seg√∫n lo expresado por el SMN, la alerta amarilla -y tambi√©n la naranja- permanecer√°n activa durante todo el primer d√≠a del mes de noviembre. Una alerta amarilla por tormentas significa que ‚Äúel √°rea ser√° afectada por tormentas localmente fuertes. Las mismas pueden estar acompa√±adas por abundante ca√≠da de agua en cortos per√≠odos, r√°fagas intensas, importante actividad el√©ctrica y ca√≠da de granizo‚Äù. Mientras que la alerta naranja se√±ala que ‚Äúel √°rea ser√° afectada por tormentas fuertes o severas, las cuales estar√°n acompa√±adas por muy intensas r√°fagas, fuerte actividad el√©ctrica, ca√≠da de granizo y abundante ca√≠da de agua en cortos per√≠odos‚Äù. Por otra parte, una alerta por vientos fuertes se activa cuando estos superan los 100 km/h. Alerta amarilla por tormentas: qu√© zonas ser√°n afectadas - Buenos Aires: Costa de Patagones - Azul - Rauch - Tapalqu√© - Zona baja de Benito Ju√°rez - Zona baja de Tandil - Bol√≠var - Carlos Casares - Carlos Tejedor - Hip√≥lito Yrigoyen - Pehuaj√≥ - Adolfo Alsina - Daireaux - Guamin√≠ - Pellegrini - Salliquel√≥ - Trenque Lauquen - Tres Lomas - Norte de Bah√≠a Blanca - Oeste de Patagones - Oeste de Villarino - Puan - Zona baja de Coronel Pringles - Zona baja de Coronel Su√°rez - Zona baja de Saavedra - Zona baja de Tornquist - C√≥rdoba: Ju√°rez Celman - Zona baja de R√≠o Cuarto - General Roca - Presidente Roque S√°enz Pe√±a - La Pampa: Zona baja de Belgrano - Zona baja de Juan Mart√≠n de Pueyrred√≥n - Chapaleuf√∫ - Marac√≥ - Rancul - Realic√≥ - Trenel - Caleu Caleu - San Luis: Hucal Zona baja de Coronel Pringles - Zona baja de General Pedernera - Gobernador Dupuy Las zonas afectadas por la alerta amarilla por vientos fuertes - Chubut: Brand Gastre - Oeste de M√°rtires - Oeste de Telsen - Paso de Indios - R√≠o Negro: Meseta de Pilcaniyeu - Meseta de √ëorquinc√≥ - Nueve de Julio - Oeste de El Cuy - Veinticinco de Mayo - Cordillera de Cushamen - Neuqu√©n: Este de Loncopu√© - Este de Picunches - Este de √ëorqu√≠n - Oeste de A√±elo - Oeste de Pehuenches - Sur de Chos Malal - Sur de Minas - La Pampa: Atreuc√≥ - Capital - Catril√≥ - Conhelo - Guatrach√© - Quem√∫ Quem√∫ - Toay - Utrac√°n - Mendoza: General Alvear - Zona baja de San Rafael - San Luis: Gobernador Dupuy Cu√°les son las zonas que est√°n en alerta naranja por vientos fuertes - Chubut: Meseta de Escalante - Meseta de R√≠o Senguer - Sarmiento - Sudoeste de Florentino Ameghino - Santa Cruz: Meseta de Deseado - Meseta de Magallanes - Meseta de Corpen Aike - Meseta de G√ºer Aike - Meseta de Lago Argentino - Costa de Magallanes
